medical_history.chief_complaint: Swellings on both sides of the neck.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The swellings were present when the patient was referred, and an ultrasound scan revealed a suspicious nodule over 2 cm in diameter in the thyroid gland, along with multiple enlarged lymph nodes. The patient's symptoms progressed, leading to a diagnosis of invasive papillary thyroid cancer.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of being raised near the Chernobyl Power Plant at the time of the accident and has undergone multiple treatments for thyroid cancer, including thyroidectomy, radioiodine therapy, and chemotherapy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient trained as a kindergarten teacher and gave birth to a healthy son in 2007. Both the patient and son are doing well.
